CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 9, 1952, pg. 16, reads: "UNIVERSITY OF PITTSBURGH MID-YEAR COMMENCEMENT - Eighteen Negroes were among the 506 awarded degrees at commencement exercises at Soldiers and Sailors Memorial Hall last Friday afternoon. Dr. Carter Davidson, president of Union COllege, gave the commencement address.  Two Negro educators were granted doctorates.  They were Inabel Burns Lindsay, dean of the School of Social Work at Howard University, and Donald Anderson Edwards, assistant professor of physics at Lincoln University, who completed his work for the degree of Doctor of Philosophy.  Dr. Lindsay and Fletcher L. White who earned a Bachelor of Science degree in education, and missing from the photos....In the bottom, far left photo, are, left to right: Bessie A. Pettett, who received her Bachelor of Arts degree from the college, and who leaves Feb. 12 to join the staff of Akron (Ohio) Community Center,  She studied sociology as a major, was a member of Delta Sigma Theta Sorority, Pitt Singers and the 'Religion in Life' group.  A sister, Erma A. Pettett, received her Bachelor of Arts degree in education from Cheyney State College last month.  They are daughters of the Rev. and Mrs. W. D. Pettett of Homewood.  Next to Miss Pettett is Marjorie A. Carter, who received a Bachelor of Arts degree from the college; Octavia Perkins, who earned a Bachelor of Science degree in School of Education, and Mildred Claiborne who received a Bachelor of Science degree in education.... - All Photos by Harris."
TitMainTitle: Bessie A. Pettett, Marjorie A. Carter, Octavia Perkins, and Mildred Claiborne, recipients of Bachelor of Arts degrees, at 1952 University of Pittsburgh mid-year graduation, Soldiers and Sailors Memorial Hall
